channel.title: Im a retard
channel.description:
Ok guys, i was setting my compiler but i messed up because i thought my computer ran in 32bit, but it runs on 64bit.
So when i try to open the "run" file, it said this:
invalid maximum heap size -Xmx5120m the specified size exceeds the maximum representable size. could not create the jana virtual machine.
or something very similar to that.
I just want to run my client, its just impossible. could you guys teach me how to compile using 64bits please ( i was using 32bits)

item.title: Im a retard
item.dc:creator: @Belob0g Belob0g
item.description:
@Belob0g wrote:

already did. but its not working. Please help me out dude

this is my environmetal viariable: C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_05\bin

what do i do with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Im a retard
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Set you’re environment variables :).

Read full topic

item.title: Im a retard
item.dc:creator: @Belob0g Belob0g
item.description:
@Belob0g wrote:

Great, its working; however, whats working is the source, the client’s “run” application says the patch has not been specified or something like that, please help me?

Read full topic

item.title: Im a retard
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

iirc, -xmxs###m has to be a smaller size than > *

Just

-Xms215m -Xmx512m

Read full topic

item.title: Im a retard
item.dc:creator: @Belob0g Belob0g
item.description:
@Belob0g wrote:

@Scape

@echo off
@title RUN MATRIX
java -XX:-OmitStackTraceInFastThrow -server -Xms2048m -Xmx512m -cp bin;data/libs/netty-3.5.2.Final.jar;data/libs/FileStore.jar com.rs.Launcher false false true
pause

i got it like this. The red text its what you told me to do, however when i try laucnhing the client it says “incompatible minimum and maximum heap sizes specified”

Read full topic

item.title: Im a retard
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Lower the heap size (aka the memory being allocated). -Xmx5120m is allocating 5 gigs. Change it to a more reasonable number i.e:
-Xmx5120m to -Xmx512m

Read full topic

lol, and how do i do that.
